**Solution**:
  
(a). 

$\mathbf{x}^*=(1,100,1000)$

(b). 

\begin{equation}
\begin{aligned}
Var(\hat{y}^*+\epsilon_{new})&=Var(\mathbf{x^*}^T \mathbf{\hat{\beta}}+\epsilon_{new})\\
&=Var(\mathbf{x^*}^T \mathbf{\hat{\beta}})+Var(\epsilon_{new})\\
&=\sigma^2 (\mathbf{x^*}^T (\mathbb{X}^T\mathbb{X})^{-1}\mathbf{x^*}+1)
\end{aligned}
\end{equation}

Thus the P.I. is
$$\hat{y}^* \pm 1.96 s \sqrt{\mathbf{x^*}^T (\mathbb{X}^T\mathbb{X})^{-1}\mathbf{x^*}+1}, $$
where $s$ is the residual standard error.
  
(c). 

We can check if $\bm{x}^*$ is within the support of the given data set to avoid extrapolation; The prediction interval should be large than the confidence intervel; $\hat{y}^*$ should fall within the predection intervel.
